text: Trump’s campaign manager did collude with an alleged Russian intelligence associate at the behest of a Russian oligarch close to Putin. There’s no question about this. This is a scandal in and of itself.
author: DavidCornDC

text:
It’s already established that

1. Trump covered up he was doing business w/ Russia (and asking Putin for help) while campaigning. 

2. Top Trump advisers agreed to work w/ a Kremlin effort to secretly help Trump. 

3. Trump aided the Russian attack by denying it was happening.
author: DavidCornDC

text: Will Mueller’s report answer the big questions he has raised about Trump-Russia interactions? We don’t know. Not yet.
author: DavidCornDC

text: Barr's letter to the judiciary committees refers to the possibility of sharing w/ them Mueller's "principal conclusions." But it's unclear what these "conclusions" might cover. His letter says nothing re whether this report that might contain new information & answer questions.
author: DavidCornDC

text:
It remains unclear whether the report Mueller has given to Barr contains:

1) New information
2) Classified information
3) Grand jury information
4) Conclusions
5) Many or few pages
author: DavidCornDC

text: Can the Internet not go crazy over this? We don't know if this report will contain new information or merely summarize the prosecutions Mueller has already mounted.
author: DavidCornDC

text: Important point. Trump lied to the public about his business “collusion” with Putin’s office on the Moscow project while running for president. So he was in no position to criticize or challenge Putin’s attack on the 2016 election. That’s one big scandal in and of itself.
author: DavidCornDC

text: You do know, don't you, that Steele never claimed to have been in Russia and that he used a network of sources including people who were in Russia and people who traveled to Russia, right? You're showing your ignorance, @RudyGiuliani. Details matter.

text: So on every anniversary of the misguided and mis-sold invasion of Iraq, you ought to skip the justifications and just apologize. And maybe do that every day in between. Have a good day.

text: By the way, while misleading the public, you totally screwed up planning for the post-invasion period. Thanks to that, thousands of US GIs were killed and hundreds of thousands of Iraqi civilians died. And, oh yeah, ISIS.
author: DavidCornDC

text: Your White House cited the tubes as concrete evidence of a nuclear weapon program, even though the top experts in the govt on nuclear weapons said these tubes were not suitable for such a program. Another lie.
author: DavidCornDC

text: Yes, there were some intel reports noting the existence of WMD programs. But the Bush-Cheney crowd exaggerated these findings and ignored or denied the contrary evidence. Such as with the case of the aluminum tubes....
author: DavidCornDC

text: Bush at one point said US intel didn’t know if Saddam already had a nuclear bomb. But US intel had concluded that at best there was a nuclear program but not one that had reached the point of producing a bomb. Another lie.
author: DavidCornDC

text: Cheney then repeatedly claimed there was intelligence showing the 9/11 ringleader had met with Iraqi intelligence in Prague. But the CIA had concluded this report was false. Another lie.
author: DavidCornDC

text: Damn, Ari. I’ve been through this BS before. Cheney started out your push for war in a major speech claiming Saddam was amassing WMDs to use against the US. There was no intelligence concluding that. It was a lie.
